p: The material was incubated in a microbiological incubator at a constant temperature of 35 ± 2 °C for 24 h (Javadpour et al. 1996). After incubation, 20 μL of Resazurin sodium red dye (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO) was added to each well in the antibacterial tests, letting it rest for 1 h at room temperature. Regarding the interpretation of the results, the wells which stayed blue were considered a positive result and those which went red were considered negative (Salvat et al. 2001). The interpretation of the antifungal activity was carried out through observation of turbidity. All assays were performed at least 3 times and the most common result was used.
